title: The US President is actively working to repeat the atmosphere that culminated in his last election victory
description: He's gathered the same people. He's attempting a similar schedule. He even believes he's found an equivalent 11th-hour scandal -- and equivalent Russian disinformation questions have followed.

title: Boxer Teófimo López has become the youngest four-belt champion in history
description: Teófimo López Jr. solidified his place in boxing's pantheon by becoming the youngest four-belt champion in the history of the sport.

title: Opinion: America got cheated
description: In the pantheon of Greek gods, Dionysus loomed large. He was the god of fertility, the god of wine and, at the springtime festivals held in his name, the deity most closely associated with the birth of theater.

title: Samuel Paty beheading: Teacher's slaying spurs protests across France
description: Demonstrators took to the streets of French locales Sunday lauding free speech and decrying violence against educators after the slaying of a teacher who used caricatures of Islam's Prophet Muhammad during a lesson.

title: Evacuations ordered in Colorado and Utah as crews battle new blazes
description: Blazes roaring through Colorado and Utah have pushed people from their homes and caused damage that officials have not yet been able to assess.

title: Trump campaign aide laughs off President's incendiary rhetoric as 'having fun'
Pelosi sets 48-hour deadline to approve stimulus deal before the election
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Sunday she and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin must reach an agreement within 48 hours if they want to pass a coronavirus stimulus relief bill before Election Day.

title: Analysis: Trump continues bizarre appeals to 'suburban women'
description: If President Donald Trump loses his reelection bid in November, it will be in part because of his fundamental misunderstanding of the beliefs of "suburban women," whom he has tried to win back with a series of bizarre and racist appeals that seem more targeted to a stereotype from the 1950s and 1960s than the American women who actually live in those areas today.

title: Trump continues bizarre appeals to suburban women
NASA and Nokia are putting a 4G network on the moon
description: If you're unable to get a cell phone signal when you walk your dog around the block, this will really make your blood boil: NASA is putting a 4G network on the moon.

title: Forget that pumpkin spice flavored latte. That is not pumpkin. These foods are
description: If 2020 has turned you into an unexpected expert in making homemade treats, maybe it's time to start pondering the pumpkin.

title: These companies' workers may never go back to the office
description: As the United States prepares for another wave of the coronavirus, some companies are making plans to keep their employees remote for the forseeable future.

title: Covid-19 vaccine company under federal investigation after allegedly misrepresenting its role in government program Operation Warp Speed
description: California biotech company Vaxart, which is working on a Covid-19 vaccine, is under federal investigation and is being sued by a number of investors for allegedly exaggerating its involvement in the US government's Operation Warp Speed program for developing Covid-19 vaccines and treatments.

title: Officers deploy crowd control agents at protesters outside an ICE building in Portland
description: Tensions between protesters, federal officers and Portland police escalated Saturday night outside a US Immigration and Customs Enforcement building in the city.

title: The latest on the 2020 election
Kremlin dismisses vaccine disinformation campaign accusations as 'circus'
description: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov dismissed the reaction of the UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab to the Times report saying that Russia is engaging in a disinformation campaign to discredit the Oxford University coronavirus vaccine in an effort to promote its own vaccine Sputnik V, developed by the Gamaleya Institute.

title: As coronavirus surges across the US, only 2 states are trending in the right direction
description: There is nearly no place in America where Covid-19 case counts are trending in the right direction as the country heads into what health experts say will be the most challenging months of the pandemic so far.

title: 5 alternatives to the iPhone 12 that cost under $700
description: Apple's new iPhone 12 lineup has some strong selling points — 5G connectivity, dual cameras (three on the Pro versions), a powerful processor and a thinner, lighter design than the iPhone 11.

title: Trump coronavirus adviser undermines importance of masks
description: White House coronavirus task force member Dr. Scott Atlas sought to undermine the importance of face masks on Saturday as coronavirus cases spike across the US.

title: More than 46,000 fans present as New Zealand beats Australia in Bledisloe Cup
description: A near-capacity 46,049 crowd was present at Eden Park as New Zealand defeated Australia 27-7 in game two of the Bledisloe Cup.

title: Mexican restaurant takes political stand with sign declaring 'No Love, No Tacos'
description: A Mexican restaurant in a small town in Iowa has wrapped itself in the middle of political discourse after some customers of the popular eatery took offense to a yard sign the owner placed outside.

title: You can now rent a private AMC theater for just $99
description: A crisp Benjamin Franklin can get you your own private AMC movie theater.

title: Band played a concert encased in plastic bubbles. So were the fans
description: It's unclear whether The Flaming Lips are using jelly -- or vaseline, for that matter -- at their concerts these days. The rock band is, however, trying plastic bubbles.

title: Analysis: Why Biden is putting so many red states in play
description: Poll of the week: A new Quinnipiac University poll of likely Georgia voters finds former Vice President Joe Biden at 51% and President Donald Trump at 44%.

title: Analysis: Trump's rallies make no political sense. Here's why he does them anyway.
description: President Donald Trump's bout with coronavirus gave him the chance for a reset on the top 2020 election issue. Characteristically, he has spurned it.

title: 'SNL' takes on the dueling town halls between Trump and Biden
description: Instead of a presidential debate, this week had dueling town halls between President Donald Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden. "Saturday Night Live" covered both, like many viewers, by flipping back and forth between the two.

title: Consensus is falling apart as second wave engulfs Europe
description: As coronavirus cases spike across the continent, European governments are facing a new obstacle in their efforts to enforce restrictions -- with several major cities and regions fighting back against instructions to lock down in recent days.

title: Dutch king cuts short vacation in Greece after criticism
description: The Netherlands' King Willem-Alexander and his wife cut short a vacation to Greece on Friday after coming under criticism for traveling during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Arrest of former defense minister shatters trust in Mexico's armed forces
description: The general's speech was forceful and unequivocal, his demeanor somber and severe. Impeccably dressed in full military uniform, Salvador Cienfuegos Zepeda, then Mexican Secretary of Defense, spoke before a group of thousands of Mexican soldiers under his command on a spring day in April 2016 at Military Camp Number One, near Mexico City.

title: Kim's tears and the West's missile fears made for a discordant display in Pyongyang
Coronavirus could drive the last nail into a controversial industry
description: As coronavirus tears through the world's mink farms, the pandemic is accelerating the shuttering of a controversial industry.

title: What's next for the US-North Korea relationship?
description: Following North Korea's unveiling of a huge new missile at a military parade celebrating the 75th anniversary of the Workers' Party, CNN's Paula Hancocks looks at what these developments mean for the US.
